hero.headline: Physical
hero.description: Ruggedized, solar-powered edge nodes designed for deployment in the most challenging environments. Built to operate autonomously for years without grid power or maintenance.

nodes.name: TrueLeap Node X1
nodes.description: Our flagship edge computing unit, designed for community-scale deployments. Serves up to 500 concurrent users within a 5km radius.

nodes.name: TrueLeap Node S1
nodes.description: Gateway node with multi-constellation satellite connectivity. Bridges local mesh networks to global internet.

nodes.name: TrueLeap Node M1
nodes.description: Rapid-deployment unit for emergency response and temporary installations. Operational within 30 minutes of arrival.

features.title: Weather-Sealed Enclosure
features.description: IP67-rated enclosures withstand extreme temperatures (-40°C to +60°C), humidity, dust, and rain.

features.title: Self-Healing Mesh
features.description: Nodes automatically discover neighbors and form resilient mesh networks that route around failures.

features.title: Remote Management
features.description: Full remote monitoring, configuration, and software updates via our Digital Twin platform.

features.title: Modular Design
features.description: Hot-swappable components for field servicing. Replace batteries, radios, or compute modules without tools.

deploymentModels.name: Cluster Deployment
deploymentModels.description: Multiple X1 nodes covering a village or campus, connected via mesh networking to a single S1 gateway.

deploymentModels.name: Linear Deployment
deploymentModels.description: Nodes deployed along roads, rivers, or transit corridors to provide continuous coverage.
deploymentModels.ideal: Agricultural areas, supply chains, transit routes

deploymentModels.name: Hub-and-Spoke
deploymentModels.description: Central S1 node with multiple X1 nodes extending coverage in all directions.

cta.headline: Ready to deploy?
